introduction.description: Office Supplies is a highly visible area for Sustainable Procurement, as employees will immediately realise the efforts made to improve the sustainability performance of the organisation's operations. Office Supplies encompasses a wide range of products, from writing instruments and paper to toner cartridges. We included Cleaning Products & Services and Textiles in this section.
key_environmental_impacts: Forest destruction and potential loss of biodiversity
Energy and water consumption during production
Waste from disposal (unless reprocessed or recycled)
Heavy metals (e.g. mercury, cadmium, lead, nickel) and chemicals (e.g. chlorine substances, colorants and dyes)
introduction.best_advice: less is more. Start with Reducing and Reusing your supplies, you will save money and waste.

solutions.title: Measure & Monitor
solutions.description: Measuring your office carbon footprint is a key step for a greener office. It is of high importance for an efficient environmental management: if you don't measure it, you can't manage it! It requires methodology and proper data collection: papers expenses, electronic equipments, electricity charges, office supplies...
steps: Implement an adequate procedure to measure across all departments.
Set annually reduction targets to continuously improve.
resources: UK-based WRAP.org guide for suggested sources of data and units of measure

solutions.title: Set up a Sustainable Procurement Policy - BASIC
solutions.description: Although some sustainable products may still be more expensive than non-sustainable ones, this 'extra cost' will be offset in the long run by better procurement practices. A quick positive outcome is that it will help you raise awareness and improve your reputation with your employees and end customers.
solutions.key_principle: Take into account the whole life cycle of your supplies, from manufacturing to end of product life

steps.step: 1- Analyse your current consumption and existing practices
details: Identify your most purchased products and unused references (20/80 rule)
Ask your suppliers what are the carbon footprints for your 20% most purchased products

examples: % of sustainable or eco-certified office products purchases (to be done per category: paper, inks cartridges…)
Carbon footprint evolution for main office products purchased. Eliminate higher footprints products and replace them with lesser carbon footprint products

options: certified products (always ask for proof of certification). See Green Label Singapore

actions: Limit your annual number of orders to decrease logistics/transportation cost by aggregating orders among services/departments & defining a minimum amount per order
Reduce your suppliers list: limit order volumes and aggregate volumes on 1 or 2 suppliers to optimize cost
Limit the number of supplies references, eliminate unused references and define a green list, to negotiate better prices on less references with higher volumes

steps.action: Discuss with your supplier to limit packagings, e.g. all pens in 1 carton box

details: Employees: present the green product lines to them (especially people in charge of office supplies) in order to get their support
Suppliers: involve them in the green purchasing policy, share objectives and let them find better sustainable options for you

solutions.title: Plan a Stationery Amnesty
solutions.description: Organise a yearly stationery amnesty: 'an event where everyone in an office or building is invited to get rid of their unused and unwanted stationery (pens, staplers, envelopes, etc.) so it can be collected and reused. This saves money, as you don't need to buy new stationery, prevents items from going to landfill unnecessarily, and frees up space.'
solutions.quote_source: Rémi Césaro, Resource Efficiency Consultant - Zero Waste City
solutions.implementation: 4 steps to implement your stationery amnesty available from Zero Waste City

solutions.title: Reuse Office Supplies
solutions.description: Maximise reuse of all office supplies.
solutions.additional: To go a step further, consider a yearly Stationery Amnesty

solutions.title: Choose Sustainable Paper Products
solutions.description: Opt for recycled paper (less fresh pulp from cut-down trees) or upcycled paper (e.g. made from waste). Choose at least ECF Paper (Elemental Chlorine Free) or prefer PCF Paper (Processed Chlorine Free), FSC (Forest Stewardship Council). Apply the same for letterheads, name cards, envelopes...
solutions.second_choice: If recycled paper is not available, PEFC-certified (Program for the Endorsement of Forest Certification) paper should be your second choice
solutions.certifications: Green Label Singapore, EnergyStar, PEFC, FSC for paper… Always ask for certification proof

solutions.title: Choose Sustainable Stationery
preferences: Ink: use plant-based ink, opt for refurbished/ remanufactured cartridges
Choose refillable pens (more expensive when purchasing the pen but definitely a cost saving when buying the refills afterwards)
solutions.certifications: Green Label Singapore, EnergyStar, PEFC, FSC for paper… Always ask for certification proof

solutions.title: Choose Green Cleaning Products
preferences: Non-toxic, chemicals-free, tree-free, plastic-free products (e.g. bamboo pulp toilet paper)
solutions.note: If the choice of office cleaning products is done by your cleaning agents, discuss with them how to use eco-friendly products

solutions.title: Choose Green Cleaning Services
solutions.description: For services, prefer providers conscious of environmental and social challenges
criteria: training their employees on eco-friendly practices, natural resources' preservation & waste segregation
with clear human resources social engagements such as a safe work environment, inclusiveness and diversity policy, and real competencies development plans

solutions.title: Choose Eco-friendly Textile Merchandise
social_criteria: Safe work environment to prevent work accidents or illness
Ethical work conditions (minimum salaries levels, no forced labor, no child work...)
